title: Util
description: Utility definitions to be used in other schemas.

monster.description: Keys are other sources to be loaded; values are `otherSources` sources from that source to search for.

url.description: "uri-reference" is unsuitable for brew, as it requires URL-encoding "'" (see: https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt)

source.description: An identifying string, as seen in the JSON in "source" fields.

oneOf.description: An identifying string, as seen in the JSON in "source" fields.

tag.description: A tag used in the renderer, e.g. "creature"

max.description: The max ability score this ASI allows (otherwise assumed to be 20).

visible.description: Governs whether or not the class name is visible in the list display/prerequisite line. *Not* recommended for features which implicitly carry a class restriction, such as Eldritch Invocations.
Governs whether or not the class name is visible in the list display/prerequisite line. *Not* recommended for features which implicitly carry a class restriction, such as Eldritch Invocations.

choose.description:
A range prerequisite spells, formatted similarly to the options in a {@filter ...} tag. 
For example: "level=0|class=Wizard"

otherSummary.description: A free text prerequisite, with a shortened form for list display.

displayEntry.description: Optional long-form name to be used in the rendered entity.
Optional long-form name to be used in the rendered entity.

spellcasting2020.description: Renders with the updated text found in UA2020: Feats

spellcastingFeature.description: A more restrictive spellcasting variant; specifically "Spellcasting Feature"

spellcastingPrepared.description: A more restrictive spellcasting variant; specifically "Spellcasting feature from a class that prepares spells"

note.description: An additional note that accompanies the proficiencies, but is not part of them.

alignment.description:
L: Lawful
 N: Neutral
 NX: Neutral (law/chaos axis)
 NY: Neutral (good/evil axis)
 C: Chaotic
 G: Good
 E: Evil
 U: Unaligned
 A: Any

size.description:
F: Fine
 D: Diminutive
 T: Tiny
 S: Small
 M: Medium
 L: Large
 H: Huge
 G: Gargantuan
 C: Colossal
 V: Varies.

anyOf.$comment: This is a custom pre-processor tag, which merges together the array of objects into one. This allows proper inheritance, which JSON schema don't really do.

props.description: If unspecified, defaults to `[null, "entries", "headerEntries", "footerEntries"]`. To apply to _any_ string, including those outside of sub-properties (for instance, when trying to replace text in an array of plain strings), include `null` as one of the props (i.e. `"props": [null]`)

_preserve.description: Note that, by default, all properties are preserved for a version. To avoid preserving properties, pass an empty object `{}`.
Note that, by default, all properties are preserved for a version. To avoid preserving properties, pass an empty object `{}`.

^s\\d+$.description: Spells keyed by spell level, access to which is gated behind the character advancing to a point where they could cast those spells with e.g. a Spellcasting class feature (Mark spells from ERLW races)

_.description: Spells gained when gaining a particular feature, regardless of level or caster level

rest.description: Spells which recharge on short or long rest

daily.description: Spells which recharge on long rest

resource.description: Spells which cost a specific resource to use (such as Ki), but otherwise have no restrictions

_.description: Spells which do not fall into the above categories (i.e. have no specific recharge, and are simply known)

all.description:
A range of spells to be added, formatted similarly to the options in a {@filter ...} tag. 
For example: "level=0|class=Wizard"

choose.description:
A range of spells to be chosen from, formatted similarly to the options in a {@filter ...} tag. 
For example: "level=0|class=Wizard"

from.description: An array of spell UIDs to be chosen from.

additionalSpellsArray.description:
A collection of additional spells which a feature grants.
This array enables import functionality for VTTs, and should be used in addition to "classSpells"/"subclassSpells"/"subSubclassSpells" blocks which enable references on the site.

name.description: Optional display name for the group

ability.description: Optionally specify the ability score used for e.g. racial spellcasting

oneOf.description: "inherit" is used for special cases, where the ability score matches a choice the player made when taking the feature

resourceName.description: Optional resource name for resource-cast spells in this group

innate.description: Spells which can be innately cast, without expending normal spell resources

expanded.description: Expansions to a class' default spell list, from which spells can be chosen (e.g. Warlock Patron spells)

startingEquipment.description: Optional well-structured data version of the "default" property, for use in applications that require it.

displayName.description: The display name this item should be given

containsValue.description: The value (in copper pieces) that this piece of equipment contains in coins.

special.description: The name of a non-statted item, such as "wooden stake"

worthValue.description: The worth (in copper pieces) of this piece of equipment.

containsValue.description: The value (in copper pieces) that this piece of equipment contains in coins.

oneOf.description: Features gained when the total count of features increases according to level.
Features gained at the exact levels specified.
Features gained at the level this feature is gained.

spellListSpellRef.description: A reference to a spell or an existing spell list, linked by name and source. Assumes PHB as the source, if none is provided.

oneOf.description: A spell UID of the form "fireball" (PHB source assumed by default) or "shape water|xge"
